meanings.definition: The state or position of being a consumer.
meanings.sent1: Her consumership at the store was evident as she carefully examined each product.
meanings.sent2: In a capitalistic society, consumership plays a crucial role in driving the economy.
meanings.sent3: His consumership was so enthusiastic that he ended up buying more than he needed.
meanings.sent4: The consumership of information in the digital age is overwhelming, leading to information overload.
meanings.sent5: The consumership of the new product exceeded all expectations, leading to a sold-out status.

meanings.definition: The act of consuming goods or services.
meanings.sent1: The rapid growth of online consumership has transformed the retail industry.
meanings.sent2: Consumership of fast food has been linked to health issues like obesity.
meanings.sent3: Her consumership of chocolate was so extreme that she had a stash hidden in every room.
meanings.sent4: The consumership of entertainment content on streaming platforms is changing traditional media consumption habits.
meanings.sent5: The consumership of energy resources must be sustainable to protect the environment for future generations.
